data.title: Medieval City of Rhodes
data.text: The Medieval City of Rhodes was constructed around 1309 to 1523 and is part of the modern capital city of Rhodes on the Island of Rhodes in Greece The site was added to the UNESCO World Heritage list in 1988 The Medieval city consits of the high town to the north and the lower town south southwest The high town was entirely built by the Hospitaller Rhodes The Medieval city is located within a 4 kms long wall
